info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 11:07AM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Kentucky...Missouri...
Ohio River at Smithland Dam affecting Pope and Livingston Counties.
Ohio River at Paducah affecting Pope, Massac, McCracken and Livingston Counties.
Ohio River at Cairo affecting Alexander, Carlisle, Mississippi, Ballard, Hickman, Pulaski and Fulton Counties.
Ohio River at Olmsted Lock and Dam affecting Pulaski and Ballard Counties.
.The Ohio River is already above flood stage and will continue to rise in the coming days. Crests on the Ohio River will occur in the next 7 to 10 days.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Ohio River at Smithland Dam.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 41.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 49.5 feet Wednesday, April 16. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 49.5 feet on 04/27/2011.
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
